intro: Erythrocephalum scabrifolium, commonly known as the rough-leaved erythranthe, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, hairy, and often rough-textured leaves, which contribute to its common name. It produces showy pink to red flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erythrocephalum scabrifolium is typically found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
